words.definition: the amount that will have to be paid for something
words.example: The total cost of the trip was $2000.

words.definition: a story or event recorded by a camera as a set of moving images and shown in a theater or on television
words.example: They went to see a movie last night.

words.definition: a place, meeting, or medium where ideas and views on a particular issue can be exchanged
words.example: The online forums are great for discussing new technology.

words.definition: walk in a military manner with a regular measured tread
words.example: The soldiers began to march in the parade.

words.definition: a note to follow so; the sixth note in the sol-fa musical scale
words.example: After 'so' in the musical scale comes 'la'.

words.definition: the ninth month of the year, in the northern hemisphere usually considered the first month of autumn
words.example: Schools often start the new academic year in September.

words.definition: of a more excellent or effective type or quality
words.example: The sequel was better than the original movie.

words.definition: utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, or a feeling
words.example: I couldn't say what he meant by that comment.

words.definition: a sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information
words.example: She asked several questions during the lecture.

words.definition: the seventh month of the year, in the northern hemisphere usually considered the second month of summer
words.example: Many people go on vacation in July.

words.definition: a rude, noisy, or violent person
words.example: He behaved like a yahoo at the party.

words.definition: the condition of the ground viewed in terms of suitability for walking or riding
words.example: The going was tough on the muddy trail.

words.definition: relating to the science or practice of medicine
words.example: She is studying for a medical degree.

words.definition: a procedure intended to establish the quality, performance, or reliability of something
words.example: The prototype will undergo several tests before production.

words.definition: move or travel towards or into a place thought of as near or familiar to the speaker
words.example: Jessica came into the kitchen.

words.definition: abbreviation for December
words.example: The event is scheduled for early Dec.

words.definition: a computer or computer program which manages access to a centralized resource or service in a network
words.example: The software runs on a variety of Unix servers.

words.definition: a personal computer, often referred to as a PC, is a computer designed for individual use
words.example: I bought a new PC for my home office.

words.definition: the devotion of time and attention to gaining knowledge of an academic subject, especially by means of books
words.example: She spends hours in study for her exams.

words.definition: a formal request to be considered for a position or to be allowed to do or have something, submitted to an authority, institution, or organization
words.example: He filled out the job application carefully.

words.definition: a vehicle with either two or four wheels, pulled by a horse and used for carrying goods
words.example: Farmers used to transport hay on a cart.

words.definition: all the people employed by a particular organization
words.example: The company has a staff of over 300 employees.

words.definition: a piece of writing included with others in a newspaper, magazine, or other publication
words.example: She enjoys reading the articles in her monthly magazine.

words.definition: a title of respect for a man in Japan
words.example: Tanaka-san is a respected teacher.

words.definition: information about reactions to a product, a person's performance of a task, etc., used as a basis for improvement
words.example: The manager asked for feedback on the new project.

words.definition: another time; once more
words.example: She decided to take the test again.

words.definition: engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose
words.example: The children love to play at the park.

words.definition: direct one's gaze toward someone or something or in a specified direction
words.example: Everyone was looking at the stunning sunset.

words.definition: important topics or problems for debate or discussion
words.example: The meeting addressed several critical issues.

words.definition: the fourth month of the year, in the northern hemisphere usually considered the second month of spring
words.example: Her birthday is in April.

words.definition: at no time in the past or future; on no occasion; not ever
words.example: He promised to never be late again.

words.definition: people who use or operate something, especially a computer or other machine
words.example: The website has over a million active users.

words.definition: having all the necessary or appropriate parts
words.example: She completed the puzzle in record time.

words.definition: a public road in a city, town, or village, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides
words.example: The narrow, winding streets of Edinburgh are picturesque.

words.definition: a subject that is discussed, written about, or studied
words.example: Our discussion included topics such as acid rain and the melting of polar ice.

words.definition: a verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction
words.example: She left a comment on his post that said, ‘So hot!’

words.definition: relating to finance
words.example: He steered the country through a financial crisis.

words.definition: an object that one need not, cannot, or does not wish to give a specific name to
words.example: She began to unpack her things.

words.definition: having paid employment
words.example: The working population of the city is growing.

words.definition: in opposition to
words.example: The campaign against smoking has intensified.

words.definition: a level of quality or attainment
words.example: The company's products are all made to a high standard.

words.definition: a compulsory contribution to state revenue, levied by the government on workers' income and business profits, or added to the cost of some goods, services, and transactions
words.example: Everyone has to pay tax on their income.

words.definition: a human being regarded as an individual
words.example: He is a person of great importance.

words.definition: at a lower level or layer
words.example: The valley is visible below from the mountain top.

words.definition: able to move or be moved freely or easily
words.example: She has a mobile business that can be operated from anywhere.

words.definition: a smaller amount of; not as much
words.example: The project requires less time than initially expected.

words.definition: past tense of 'get'; to come to have or hold
words.example: She got a new book yesterday.

words.definition: a regularly updated website or web page, typically one run by an individual or small group
words.example: He writes a popular blog about technology.

words.definition: a social gathering of invited guests, typically involving eating, drinking, and entertainment
words.example: They threw a surprise party for her birthday.

words.definition: the action or process of paying someone or something, or of being paid
words.example: The payment for the service will be processed by the end of the week.

words.definition: the necessary items for a particular purpose
words.example: All climbers must check their equipment before the ascent.

words.definition: an act of logging in to a computer, database, or system
words.example: Remember to logout after your login session.

words.definition: a person who is studying at a university or other place of higher education
words.example: The library was filled with students during exam week.

words.definition: allow or permit
words.example: She let her friend borrow the book.

words.definition: a set of related measures or activities with a particular long-term aim
words.example: The government launched new programs to aid small businesses.

words.definition: present or proffer (something) for (someone) to accept or reject as desired
words.example: The company offers excellent benefits to its employees.

words.definition: of, based on, or concerned with the law
words.example: She sought legal advice from her attorney.

words.definition: at a higher level or layer than
words.example: The plane flew above the clouds.

words.definition: having happened, begun, or been done not long ago; current
words.example: She read a recent study on the subject.

words.definition: a large public green area in a town, used for recreation
words.example: Children were playing in the park.

words.definition: shops
words.example: She visited several stores to find the perfect dress.

words.definition: a position to the left or right of an object, place, or central point
words.example: He stood on the side of the road.

words.definition: take action; do something
words.example: He decided to act on the advice given to him.

words.definition: a matter or situation regarded as unwelcome or harmful and needing to be dealt with and overcome
words.example: The problem of pollution has become increasingly severe.

words.definition: of a colour at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet, as of blood, fire, or rubies
words.example: The red apple looked ripe and delicious.

words.definition: freely transfer the possession of something to someone
words.example: Please give your attention to the following safety instructions.

words.definition: the faculty by which the mind stores and remembers information
words.example: Her memory of the event was crystal clear.

words.definition: an act of presenting a play, concert, or other form of entertainment
words.example: The orchestra's performance was met with standing ovation.

words.definition: relating to society or its organization
words.example: Social interactions are an essential part of human life.

words.definition: respected and impressive
words.example: The august professor received a lifetime achievement award.

words.definition: repeat or copy out a group of words from a text or speech, typically with an indication that one is not the original author or speaker
words.example: She liked to quote her favorite lines from Shakespeare's plays.

words.definition: the principal method of human communication, consisting of words used in a structured and conventional way and conveyed by speech, writing, or gesture
words.example: Learning a new language can be challenging but rewarding.

words.definition: an account of imaginary or real people and events told for entertainment
words.example: Every night, her father would tell her a bedtime story.

words.definition: to give or hand over something in exchange for money
words.example: They had sold the car.

words.definition: a thing that is or may be chosen
words.example: She was given the option of resigning or being dismissed.

words.definition: practical contact with and observation of facts or events
words.example: He had learned his lesson by painful experience.

words.definition: a measure, quantity, or frequency, typically one measured against another quantity or measure
words.example: The island has the lowest crime rate in the world.

words.definition: bring something into existence
words.example: He created a thirty-acre lake.

words.definition: a small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock, which is inserted into a lock and turned to open or close it
words.example: There were two keys to the cupboard.

words.definition: the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or an animal
words.example: It's important to keep your body in good condition.

words.definition: having lived or existed for only a short time
words.example: A young girl came up to me and asked for money.

words.definition: a land mass in the western hemisphere consisting of the continents of North and South America joined by the Isthmus of Panama
words.example: America is known for its diverse culture and rich history.

words.definition: of great significance or value
words.example: Important habitats for wildlife.

words.definition: an area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture
words.example: The farmer worked in the field from dawn till dusk.

words.definition: a small number of
words.example: Only a few guests remained after the party.

words.definition: the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun rises at the equinoxes
words.example: The sun rises in the east.

words.definition: material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances
words.example: She wrote her thoughts down on a piece of paper.

words.definition: only one; not one of several
words.example: She bought a single ticket to the show.

words.definition: the Roman numeral for two
words.example: The sequel was titled 'Part II'.

words.definition: the length of time that a person has lived or a thing has existed
words.example: He retired at the age of 65.

words.definition: things that people do, especially in order to achieve a particular aim
words.example: The camp offers a wide range of outdoor activities.

words.definition: an association or organization dedicated to a particular interest or activity
words.example: She is a member of a book club.

words.definition: a thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule
words.example: He set a good example for the rest of the team.

words.definition: female children or young women
words.example: The girls played in the park.

words.definition: added, extra, or supplementary to what is already present or available
words.example: The project will require additional funds.

words.definition: a secret word or phrase that must be used to gain admission to a place
words.example: Enter your password to access the account.

words.definition: the most recent news or fashion
words.example: Have you heard the latest update on the event?

words.definition: a thing that is unspecified or unknown
words.example: She felt something was amiss.

words.definition: a wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface which vehicles can use
words.example: The road stretched for miles ahead.

words.definition: a thing given willingly to someone without payment; a present
words.example: Her painting was a gift from her brother.

words.definition: a sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information
words.example: He raised a question during the meeting.

words.definition: an act or process through which something becomes different
words.example: The company is undergoing significant changes.

words.definition: the period from sunset to sunrise in each twenty-four hours
words.example: The stars were visible in the night sky.

words.definition: a set of different things of the same general type
words.example: The store offers a wide range of products.

words.definition: a structure with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory
words.example: The new library building is a marvel of modern architecture.

words.definition: a person who sells something
words.example: The seller agreed to lower the price.

words.definition: a tribunal presided over by a judge, judges, or a magistrate in civil and criminal cases
words.example: The case was taken to court.

words.definition: the second month of the year, in the northern hemisphere usually considered the last month of winter
words.example: Her birthday is on February 14th.

words.definition: at all times; on all occasions
words.example: She always arrives on time.

words.definition: a consequence, effect, or outcome of something
words.example: The result of the experiment was inconclusive.

words.definition: sound, especially when recorded, transmitted, or reproduced
words.example: The audio quality of the recording was excellent.

words.definition: the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible
words.example: The room was filled with bright light.

words.definition: mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement
words.example: Please write your name on the top of the sheet.

words.definition: A state of armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
words.example: The two countries were at war for decades.

words.definition: Abbreviation for November, the eleventh month of the year
words.example: She has a trip planned for early Nov.

words.definition: Present or proffer (something) for (someone) to accept or reject as desired
words.example: He offered help to the needy family.

words.definition: Of a color intermediate between green and violet, as of the sky or sea on a sunny day
words.example: The sky is a clear blue today.

words.definition: A number of people or things that are located, gathered, or classed together
words.example: Students were asked to form groups for the project.

words.definition: An Indian tree
words.example: The al tree is known for its medicinal properties.

words.definition: Achieved without great effort; presenting few difficulties
words.example: This puzzle is relatively easy to solve.

words.definition: Specified or stated; particular
words.example: Given the circumstances, we did well.

words.definition: A folder or box for holding loose papers together and in order for easy reference
words.example: She organized the documents into labeled files.

words.definition: A thing that happens or takes place, especially one of importance
words.example: The concert was a significant event in the city's cultural calendar.

words.definition: the action of making a film, recording, or other product available to the public
words.example: The band's latest album will be released next week.

words.definition: detailed examination of the elements or structure of something
words.example: The data can be fed to a computer for detailed analysis.

words.definition: an act of asking politely or formally for something
words.example: They received hundreds of requests for more information.

words.definition: a device for transmitting and receiving documents over telephone lines
words.example: Please fax the document to the number provided.

words.definition: a fine white or translucent vitrified ceramic material
words.example: The delicate china teacups were displayed in the cabinet.

words.definition: the process of producing or forming something
words.example: The documentary showed the making of the famous sculpture.

words.definition: a visual representation made by painting, drawing, or photography
words.example: The gallery exhibited pictures by well-known artists.

words.definition: circumstances in which something is necessary or that require some course of action; necessity
words.example: Basic needs include food, clothing, and shelter.

words.definition: able to be done or achieved, or able to exist
words.example: It might be possible to arrange an alternative appointment.

words.definition: used to express possibility or make a suggestion
words.example: If you hurry, you might catch the bus.

words.definition: relating to or connected with a profession
words.example: She sought professional advice on her investments.

words.definition: up until the present or a specified or implied time; by now or then
words.example: I haven't finished my homework yet.

words.definition: each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided
words.example: Her birthday is in the month of June.

words.definition: important, serious, or significant
words.example: The company announced a major breakthrough in cancer research.

words.definition: a fixed luminous point in the night sky which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun
words.example: You can see the stars clearly on a dark night.

words.definition: a region or part of a town, a country, or the world
words.example: The company plans to expand its operations to new areas.

words.definition: the time or a period of time following the moment of speaking or writing; time regarded as still to come
words.example: We need to plan for the future.

words.definition: a continuous area or expanse which is free, available, or unoccupied
words.example: The new design gives us more space in the kitchen.
